instruction: Complete the sentences. Use a verb + on/off (sometimes with it/the light etc.).

items.prompt: 1) The room is dark. Please ______ the light ______.
2) It's too hot. Could you ______ the heating ______?
3) I can't hear you. ______ the TV ______ a bit.
4) The music is loud. Can you ______ it ______?
5) I'm freezing. I'll ______ the kettle ______ for tea.

instruction: Choose the correct phrasal verb: go on / call off / put off.

items.prompt: 1) The match was cancelled because of heavy rain. They decided to ______ it ______.
2) The speaker is late, but the meeting will ______ without him.
3) We can't decide today. Let's ______ the discussion until tomorrow.
4) The concert will ______ as planned.
5) They had to ______ the trip because of a strike.
6) The problem is serious, but we have to ______ and deal with it.
7) The game was ______ at the last minute.
8) If you’re tired, you can ______ working on this tomorrow.
9) The fireworks display will ______ at 9 p.m.
10) They ______ the wedding until next summer.
11) We’ll ______ with the plan even if it’s difficult.
12) The organisers ______ the event due to safety concerns.

instruction: Complete the sentences. Use a suitable verb + on/off.

items.prompt: 1) It's cold outside. She picked up her gloves and ______ them ______.
2) The plane left the ground at 10:55. It ______ ______ on time.
3) The jacket was too small, so he ______ it ______ and chose a larger size.
4) There was a storm, so they ______ the picnic ______.
5) We went to the station to ______ our friend ______.
6) The sun was bright, so she took her sunglasses out and ______ them ______.

instruction: Choose the correct meaning.

items.prompt: 1) The lecture went on for ages.
2) He keeps on forgetting my name.
3) How are you getting on with the course?
4) I don't get on with my boss.
5) I nodded off during the film.
6) She told me off for shouting.

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) If you want to finish, don't stop now. ______ ______!
2) We were tired, but we decided to ______ ______ walking.
3) Please don't ______ ______ about the same problem.
4) Stop chatting and ______ ______ with your homework.
5) I'm ______ ______ well with my driving lessons.
6) They don't ______ ______ with their neighbours.
7) I was so sleepy that I ______ ______ on the train.
8) Can you ______ ______ the pizza? There's only one slice left.
9) The alarm ______ ______ at 5 a.m.
10) His rude comment really ______ me ______.
11) They charged me double. I think they tried to ______ me ______.
12) He's always ______ ______ in front of other people.
13) The teacher ______ him ______ for using his phone.
14) She ______ ______ working even when she felt ill.
15) We should ______ ______ with the plan and stop delaying.

instruction: Complete the dialogues with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) A: Are you still working?  B: Yes, I'll ______ ______ for another hour.
2) A: I'm bored.  B: Let's ______ ______ and finish this quickly.
3) A: Did you sleep well?  B: No, I ______ ______ in the meeting!
4) A: What happened to the cake?  B: I ______ it ______.
5) A: Why are you angry?  B: The manager ______ me ______ in front of everyone.
6) A: Is the party cancelled?  B: No, it's still ______ ______.
7) A: Do you like your new class?  B: Yes, I ______ ______ well with everyone.
8) A: That shop is expensive.  B: Yes, they really ______ people ______.

instruction: Complete the sentences with up or down phrasal verbs.

items.prompt: 1) Please ______ ______. I can't hear you at the back. (from sitting)
2) I'm tired. I'm going to ______ ______ for a minute. (on the sofa)
3) She ______ the child ______ so he could see over the crowd.
4) Put the box ______ and take a rest.
5) Can you ______ the volume ______? It's too quiet.
6) It's late. Let's ______ the music ______.
7) When the teacher came in, everyone ______ ______.
8) He opened the book and ______ it ______ on the desk.

instruction: Complete the sentences with knock down / cut down / burn down (or be knocked down).

items.prompt: 1) They plan to ______ the old cinema ______ to build flats.
2) A cyclist was hit by a car and was ______ ______.
3) The council ______ two diseased trees ______.
4) A strong wind ______ the fence ______.
5) The warehouse ______ ______ during the night.
6) The statue was ______ ______ by the explosion.

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable '... down' phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) You're driving too fast. ______ ______!
2) She was upset, but after a while she ______ ______.
3) I'm trying to ______ ______ ______ coffee.
4) The computer system ______ ______ for an hour.
5) The factory will ______ ______ next year.
6) Please ______ the number ______. You'll forget it.
7) I asked her out, but she ______ me ______.
8) Don't promise if you might ______ people ______.
9) We need to ______ ______ the noise.
10) After the race, he had to ______ ______.
11) Can you ______ ______? You're shouting.
12) She wants to ______ ______ ______ sweets.

instruction: Complete the sentences with catch up / keep up / hurry up.

items.prompt: 1) I missed the first part of the film, so I need to ______ ______ with the story.
2) Walk faster! I can't ______ ______ with you.
3) ______ ______! The bus is leaving.
4) After illness, she trained hard to ______ ______.

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) They ______ ______ a meeting for Monday morning.
2) He ______ ______ photography last year.
3) Can you ______ ______ the broken chair?
4) I ______ ______ in Kyiv, but now I live abroad.

8) I'll ______ ______ and then we can go out.
9) She ______ ______ an internet connection for the office.
10) This hobby ______s ______ a lot of time.
11) After dinner, who will ______ ______?

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) We planned to go out, but we ______ ______ staying at home.
2) Don't ______ ______. You can do it!
3) He ______ the story ______. None of it was true.
4) Sorry I'm late. Something ______ ______.

7) We've ______ ______ all the sugar.
8) He ______ ______ a lot of space in the fridge.
9) I need to ______ ______ on sleep this weekend.
10) If you ______ ______ now, you'll regret it.
11) They ______ ______ in the wrong hotel.

instruction: Choose the correct phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) I didn't have a reason, so I had to ______ an excuse.
2) Her name ______ in our conversation yesterday.
3) Can you ______ ______ a solution to this problem?
4) Don't ______ that topic ______ again. It's sensitive.
5) I'm putting money aside each month to ______ for a new laptop.
6) It was raining, but it started to ______ later in the afternoon.
7) You look miserable—try to ______ ______!

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) It was cloudy in the morning, but by noon it had ______ ______.
2) Sorry I'm late. I was ______ ______ in traffic.
3) They bought an old flat and ______ it ______.
4) He was sad, but his friends ______ him ______.

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) A new problem ______ ______ just before the deadline.
2) The bomb ______ ______ and damaged the car.
3) He was attacked and ______ ______.
4) After ten years together, they ______ ______.
5) Can you ______ ______ your jacket? It's cold.
6) The sky ______ ______ and we saw the sun.

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) I didn't know the word, so I ______ it ______ in a dictionary.
2) I can't ______ ______ ______ his behaviour any longer.
3) We were ______ ______ for two hours because of an accident.
4) They ______ ______ after a long argument.
5) She ______ her coat ______ and went outside.
6) They bought an old house and ______ it ______.
7) I always ______ the twins ______ because they look the same.
8) He got angry and ______ the contract ______.
9) She ______ the problem ______ in the meeting again.

instruction: Complete the sentences with away/back or a suitable verb + away/back.

items.prompt: 1) He waved at me, and I ______ ______.
2) The wind was so strong it almost blew my hat ______.
3) This old receipt is useless—I'll ______ it ______.
4) The child shouted, so the mother shouted ______.
5) He hit me, so I hit him ______.
6) I smiled, and she smiled ______.

instruction: Complete the sentences with away or back.

items.prompt: 1) She moved ______ last year and now lives in Canada.
2) I'll be ______ in ten minutes.
3) When are you coming ______ from holiday?
4) The dog ran ______ when it saw the fireworks.
5) Can you give me my book ______?
6) The thief managed to get ______.

instruction: Complete the sentences with a suitable phrasal verb with away/back.

items.prompt: 1) The barking was constant. In the end it ______ the neighbours ______.
2) Please don't ______ ______ the instructions. You might need them.
3) He copied in the exam, but he ______ ______ ______ it.
4) I'm ______ all weekend, so I won't answer messages.
5) It was a horrible scene, so I ______ ______.
6) She ______ ______ all her old books to charity.
7) I'm busy now. I'll ______ you ______ later.
8) After dinner, please ______ the food ______ in the fridge.

instruction: Complete the dialogues with a suitable phrasal verb.

items.prompt: 1) A: This isn't mine.  B: OK, I'll ______ it ______ to you. (give)
2) A: These papers are old.  B: Then ______ them ______. (throw)
3) A: I didn't mean it.  B: You can't just ______ it ______ now. (take)
4) A: Can I borrow €20?  B: Sure, but please ______ me ______ next week. (pay)
5) A: I don't need these clothes.  B: You could ______ them ______. (give)
6) A: I missed your call.  B: No problem. I'll ______ you ______ in a minute. (call)
